questions.question: Which UNESCO site in the Andes commemorates the largest and most sophisticated empire in ancient South America?
questions.context: An iconic symbol of the Inca Empire, this site was largely unknown to the outside world until 1911 and offers breathtaking views from the mountain ridge above the Sacred Valley.

questions.question: Which architectural wonder is an iconic symbol of ancient Egyptian engineering, with alignment to the cardinal points?
questions.context: Built during the Fourth Dynasty for the Pharaoh Khufu, this pyramid is the largest of the three pyramids located at the Giza complex.

questions.question: Where is the historic site of one of World War II's most crucial battles marked by the famous raising of the flag photo?
questions.context: This volcanic mountain became infamous as the location where U.S. Marines famously raised the American flag in 1945, symbolizing victory at one of the most hard-fought battles.

questions.question: Which space exploration site launched the first human into orbit, showcasing Soviet triumph in the space race?
questions.context: Launched in 1961, Yuri Gagarin's historic flight from this site marked a pivotal moment in space exploration history.
